## Two Column Layout

```{python}
# | label: two-column-layout
from great_tables.data import islands

islands_first_10 = (
    pl.from_pandas(islands)
    .sort("size", descending=True)
    .slice(0, 10)
)

islands_second_10 = (
    pl.from_pandas(islands)
    .sort("size", descending=True)
    .slice(10, 10)
)

def make_gt_table(data):
    gt = (
        GT(data)
        .tab_stub(rowname_col="name")
        .tab_stubhead(label="landmass")
        .fmt_integer(columns="size")
        .tab_header(title="Large Landmasses of the World")
    )

    gt = gt.pipe(
        gte.gt_color_box,
        columns="size",
        domain=[0, 17000],
        palette=["lightblue", "darkblue"]
    )

    return gt

gt1 = make_gt_table(islands_first_10)
gt2 = make_gt_table(islands_second_10)

gte.gt_two_column_layout(gt1, gt2, table_header_from=1)
```
